ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Out of 1,000 people in a small town 500 are members of a choir. Out of these 500 members in the choir 100 are men. Out of the 500 inhabitants that are not in the choir 300 are men. What is the probability that a randomly drawn man is a member of the choir? Please indicate the probability in percent.
Imagine we are throwing a five-sided die 50 times. On average, out of these 50 throws how many times would this five-sided die show an odd number (1, 3 or 5)?

Imagine we are throwing a loaded die (6 sides). The probability that the die shows a 6 is twice as high as the probability of each of the other numbers. On average, out of these 70 throws how many times would the die show the number 6?

In a forest 20% of mushrooms are red, 50% brown and 30% white. A red mushroom is poisonous with a probability of 20%. A mushroom that is not red is poisonous with a probability of 5%. What is the probability that a poisonous mushroom in the forest is red?
Total Score - Berlin Numeracy Test, Computer Adaptive Test form, 2-3 items
Notes: 1= Q1 incorrect, Q2a incorrect; 2= Q1 incorrect, Q2a correct; 3= Q1 correct, Q2b incorrect, Q3 incorrect; 4= Q1 correct, Q2b incorrect and Q3 correct OR Q2b correct

ElementDescription: Total Score - Berlin Numeracy Test, Paper and Pencil format, 4 items
Total Score - Berlin Numeracy Test, Single item format
Imagine we are throwing a five-sided die 50 times. On average, out of these 50 throws how many times would this five-sided die show an odd number (1, 3 or 5)?
Notes: 1= a) 5 out of 50 throws; 2= b) 25 out of 50 throws; 3= c) 30 out of 50 throws (correct); 4= d) None of the above

ElementDescription: Out of 1,000 people in a small town 500 are members of a choir. Out of these 500 members in the choir 100 are men. Out of the 500 inhabitants that are not in the choir 300 are men. What is the probability that a randomly drawn man is a member of the choir? Please indicate the probability in percent.
Notes: 1= a) 10%; 2= b) 25% (correct); 3= c) 40%; 4= d) None of the above

ElementDescription: Imagine we are throwing a loaded die (6 sides). The probability that the die shows a 6 is twice as high as the probability of each of the other numbers. On average, out of these 70 throws how many times would the die show the number 6?
Notes: 1= a) 20 out of 50 throws (correct); 2= b) 23 out of 50 throws; 3= c) 35 out of 50 throws; 4= d) None of the above

ElementDescription: In a forest 20% of mushrooms are red, 50% brown and 30% white. A red mushroom is poisonous with a probability of 20%. A mushroom that is not red is poisonous with a probability of 5%. What is the probability that a poisonous mushroom in the forest is red?
Notes: 1= a) 4%; 2= b) 20%; 3= c) 50% (correct); 4= d) None of the above

ElementDescription: Total Score - Berlin Numeracy Test, Multiple Choice format, 4 items
Date on which the first numeracy question was completed (if different then Interview_date). MM/DD/YYYY
Notes: Intended to deal with a survey that included one question on a different session
